qas.question: What is the main reasoning behind Unit testing that involves synchronization of the application on a broad spectrum?

answers.text: reduce software development risks, time, and costs

qas.question: Who performs the Unit testing phase?
What does Unit testing look to eliminate?
By elimination construction errors, what is the expected end result?

answers.text: increase the quality of the resulting software

plausible_answers.text: synchronized application of a broad spectrum of defect prevention and detection strategies in order to reduce software development risks, time, and costs.

qas.question: Unit testing is a firmware development that involves what?
Unit testing is preformed by the architect or what kind of developer?
Instead of reducing traditional QA focuses, unit testing does what to it?
Unit testing tries to eliminate collaboration errors before what?

context: Unit testing is a software development process that involves <b4_0>synchronized application of a broad spectrum of defect prevention and detection strategies in order to <a0_0>reduce software development risks, time, and costs<a0_0/>.<b4_0/> It is performed by the <a1_0><b5_0>software<b5_0/> developer or engineer<a1_0/> during the construction phase of the software development lifecycle. Rather than replace traditional QA focuses, it <b6_0>augments<b6_0/> it. Unit testing aims to eliminate <a2_0>construction errors<a2_0/> before <b7_0>code is promoted to QA<b7_0/>; this strategy is intended to <a3_0>increase the quality of the resulting software<a3_0/> as well as the efficiency of the overall development and QA process.
